greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = Sum_{d|n} sigma_3(d).
comment: Inverse Möbius transform applied twice to cubes.
link: Seiichi Manyama, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
formula: Sum_{k=1..n} a(k) ~ Pi^8 * n^4 / 32400. - _Vaclav Kotesovec_, Nov 08 2018
maple: with(numtheory): seq(coeff(series(add(sigma[3](k)*x^k/(1-x^k),k=1..n),x,n+1), x, n), n = 1 .. 45); # _Muniru A Asiru_, Oct 28 2018
mathematica: nmax = 45; Rest[CoefficientList[Series[Sum[DivisorSigma[3, k] x^k/(1 - x^k), {k, 1, nmax}], {x, 0, nmax}], x]]
f[p_, e_] := (p^3*(p^(3e+3) - e - 2) + e + 1)/(p^3 - 1)^2; a[1] = 1; a[n_] := Times @@ (f @@@ FactorInteger[n]); Array[a, 100] (* _Amiram Eldar_, Oct 25 2020 *)
program: (PARI) a(n) = sumdiv(n, d, sigma(d, 3)); \\ _Michel Marcus_, Oct 28 2018
results.author: _Ilya Gutkovskiy_, Oct 28 2018
